intro: Tragia wahlbergiana, commonly known as the Wahlberg's tragia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its unique morphology and adaptation to harsh climates make it an interesting subject in botanical studies.
